intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. varianum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has basal rosettes of leaves and grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats.
